Putin and Zelensky appear set for peace summit after fast-moving Trump talks
description: The US President spoke with Putin on Monday following a 'very good' meeting with European leaders and the Ukrainian president, Trump said. 'We are ready,' Zelensky told reporters at the White House, later saying that plans would be 'formalized in some way in the next week or ten days.'

In Poland, thousands of young people are spending their 'vacation with the army'
description: Launched in 2024, this program drew about 10,000 Poles between the ages of 18 and 35 this summer who, after 27 days of training, have now become reservists in the Polish army.

headline: Macron calls for sanctions against Russia if diplomacy fails
description: The French president reiterated Trump's belief that an agreement could be reached with Putin: 'But if at the end this process is met by refusal, we are also ready to say that we need to increase sanctions.' Macron pointed to recent secondary sanctions the US administration has imposed on India, which have 'had a lot of effects.'

headline: In northeastern France, the third life of a synagogue, transformed into a center of contemporary art
description: 'Unusual Places for an Exhibition' (1/6). Le Monde explores six art centers housed in unexpected venues. Today: a former sanctuary that was blown up by the Nazis and rebuilt after the war.

headline: 'What I would give to inhabit again a country where the gravest offense the president could be accused of was sartorial misconduct'
description: 'Letters from America' (2/6). Writer and journalist Thomas Chatterton Williams looks back at the 'ludicrous drama' caused by Barack Obama's tan suit in 2014. The contrast with Donald Trump's gaffes is striking.

The lobo-guar√°, Brazil's maned wolf, a national icon under threat
description: Emblematic of the Cerrado, these animals have seen their habitat fragmented by deforestation and the spread of industrial agriculture. In the state of Minas Gerais, a sanctuary now shelters some of them, aiming to raise public awareness.

headline: Climate change: Southern Europe scorched by flames and extreme heat
description: The Mediterranean basin is facing a new wave of heatwaves and large-scale wildfires. The affected countries have struggled to cope with the consequences of these extreme events.

headline: Henri Matisse and his heirs: The end of a financial windfall
description: Since Henri Matisse's death in 1954, four generations of his family have guarded his vast body of work jealously and with the utmost discretion. But when the painter's work entered the public domain in January, it ended the lucrative reproduction rights the heirs had enjoyed, as well as their oversight of everything concerning their ancestor.
